{"step_by_step_thinking": "Analgesics and antipyretics are medications used to relieve pain and reduce fever, respectively. After receiving a COVID-19 vaccine, some people may experience side effects such as pain at the injection site, headache, muscle pain, chills, fever, and nausea. These are normal signs that the body is building protection against the virus. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) suggests that it is okay to take these medications to relieve post-vaccination side effects, as long as you have no other medical reasons that prevent you from taking these medications.", "answer_choice": "A"}
